For most Mediterranean climate (MedClim) regions around the globe, the models consistently project drier futures
5– 7 . MedClim regions, receiving most of their precipitation during winter, are semiarid so that moderate declines in the hydroclimate can engender substantial socioeconomic impacts. However, over California the model consensus is poor, with some models trending drier, others – wetter
5 . For the peak of the wet season (December – February), as we shall see below, a weak trend towards wetter conditions in California is projected.
